title: How to Make Blue Cornmeal Muffins

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit (176° Celsius).
Spray a muffin tray with non-stick greasing spray.
Mix the dry ingredients.
steps.description: In a large bowl, whisk the cake flour, cornmeal, sugar, salt, and baking soda. Whisk until well-combined.

steps.headline: Beat the wet ingredients.
steps.description: In a medium-sized bowl, whisk the buttermilk, melted butter, and egg. Beat until the egg yolk breaks and the wet ingredients are well-combined.

steps.headline: Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and whisk until well-combined.
steps.description: Mix until the muffin batter forms and there are no more flour streaks.

steps.headline: Scoop the muffin batter into the muffin tray, leaving each case about ¾ of the way full.
Bake the muffins in the oven for about 10-12 minutes, until the edges are golden brown and the muffins rise.
Allow the muffins to cool on a wire rack for about ten minutes.
Serve.
steps.description: Place the muffins on a serving dish. Spread butter or honey over them if desired. Enjoy!

text: Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit (176° Celsius).  Spray a muffin tray with non-stick greasing spray.  Mix the dry ingredients. In a large bowl, whisk the cake flour, cornmeal, sugar, salt, and baking soda. Whisk until well-combined. Beat the wet ingredients. In a medium-sized bowl, whisk the buttermilk, melted butter, and egg. Beat until the egg yolk breaks and the wet ingredients are well-combined. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and whisk until well-combined. Mix until the muffin batter forms and there are no more flour streaks. Scoop the muffin batter into the muffin tray, leaving each case about ¾ of the way full.  Bake the muffins in the oven for about 10-12 minutes, until the edges are golden brown and the muffins rise.  Allow the muffins to cool on a wire rack for about ten minutes.  Serve. Place the muffins on a serving dish. Spread butter or honey over them if desired. Enjoy!
